snippet: An official said that a woman thought to be Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi’s wife was being questioned and that it remained unclear how much she may know about ISIS.
abstract: Lebanese authorities have detained daughter of Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, as well as the child's mother; detention may give Lebanon leverage in its efforts to free Lebanese captives held by group.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad, Anne Barnard and Mohammed Ghannam contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: An official said that a woman thought to be Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi’s wife was being questioned and that it remained unclear how much she may know about ISIS.

headline.main: Lebanon Detains ISIS Leader’s Relatives, One of Them His Daughter
headline.print_headline: Lebanon Detains Relatives of Islamic State Leader, One of Them His Daughter

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
